question: 両日
sourceMnemonic:
Kanji doesn't go together much better than this. <kanji>Both</kanji> plus <kanji>day</kanji> equals <vocabulary>both days</vocabulary>.

This is a bit of a formal word though, you'll hear important people say it more than your friends.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>日</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

On <vocabulary>both days</vocabulary> of your vacation, you get two boats to <reading>row</reading>! <reading>Gee, two</reading> (<ja>りょうじつ</ja>) boats at once? Try not to fall in!
